hedline.hl1: Soviet Is Seeking Reciprocity In Monitoring of Atom Tests

body.head.byline: Special to the New York Times

block.p: LEAD: The Soviet Union has told an American group that it may have to shut down monitoring stations near the Semipalatinsk nuclear test site unless Washington allows monitoring by Russians.

The Soviet Union has told an American group that it may have to shut down monitoring stations near the Semipalatinsk nuclear test site unless Washington allows monitoring by Russians.
The American group, the Natural Resources Defense Council, established the posts under an agreement with the Soviet Academy of Sciences that also called for posts near Nevada.
The United States Government has said the Soviet experts would have to go to the site in Nevada and observe the direct measurement of a nuclear blast. This the Russians refuse to do.
